acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Craig County under the accession number 44924.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Craig County was named for Robert Craig, a nineteenth-century Virginia congressman. The county was formed from Botetourt, Roanoke, Giles, and Monroe (West Virginia) Counties in 1851. Parts of Monroe County were added in 1853 and 1856, part of Montgomery County was added in 1853, part of Alleghany County added in 1856, and part of Giles County added in 1858.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Craig County (Va.) Slave bill of sale, undated, is half of a bill of sale from Oliver Callaghan of Botetourt County to Andrew Walker of Monroe County for slaves Judy and her son Alfred.
